channel.title: Comments on: All this, and they have socialized health care

item.title: By: Kevin Langston
item.dc:creator: Kevin Langston
item.description:
Wait, so I wasn't the only one who liked <i>Funeral</i> better than <i>Neon Bible</i>? We should start an Oddfellows Local or something.
Canada's really come on strong this past decade.
Then again, a lot of people overlook that fact that The Band â€“ one of the most American-sounding bands of all time â€“ consisted of four Canadians and one American.
item.content:encoded:
Wait, so I wasn’t the only one who liked Funeral better than Neon Bible? We should start an Oddfellows Local or something.

Canada’s really come on strong this past decade.

Then again, a lot of people overlook that fact that The Band â€“ one of the most American-sounding bands of all time â€“ consisted of four Canadians and one American.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: I totally left out <a href="http://www.drawerb.com/2006/09/07/junior-boys-so-this-is-goodbye-domino/" rel="nofollow">Junior Boys</a>. Damn, Canada!
item.content:encoded: I totally left out Junior Boys. Damn, Canada!

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description:
It pains me to admit it, but I am a total sucker for canadian indie rock, though, typically only their first albums. (stills, metric, arcade fire, Tokyo Police Club, broken social scene, etc.) Lately, I've been obsessed with Stars for no particular reason.
<object width="425" height="353"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/66yUYlOx5KM"></param><param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/66yUYlOx5KM" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" width="425" height="353"></embed></object>
item.content:encoded: It pains me to admit it, but I am a total sucker for canadian indie rock, though, typically only their first albums. (stills, metric, arcade fire, Tokyo Police Club, broken social scene, etc.) Lately, I’ve been obsessed with Stars for no particular reason.
